Class FSM_API.Create

Provides a centralized entry point for defining and creating instances of Finite State Machines (FSMs) within the API.

Inheritance
object
FSM_API.Create

object.ToString()
Namespace: TheSingularityWorkshop.FSM_API
Assembly: FSM_API.dll
Syntax
public static class FSM_API.Create
Remarks

This static class serves as a factory for FSMBuilder objects (used to construct FSM definitions) and for instantiating live FSMs from those definitions. All operations related to the initial setup and creation of FSMs go through the methods provided here.

Methods

| Edit this page View Source

CreateFiniteStateMachine(string, int, string)

Initiates the definition process for a new Finite State Machine (FSM), or provides an FSMBuilder to modify an existing FSM's definition.

Declaration
public static FSMBuilder CreateFiniteStateMachine(string fsmName = "UnNamedFSM", int processRate = 0, string processingGroup = "Update")
Parameters
Type Name Description
string fsmName

A unique, descriptive name for this FSM definition. This name is used to reference the FSM definition when creating instances or modifying it later. Defaults to "UnNamedFSM".
int processRate

The default processing rate for instances of this FSM definition.

  • 0 (default)Event-driven: FSM instances will only process when explicitly triggered by an event.
  • > 0Tick-based: FSM instances will process at a fixed interval (e.g., in milliseconds), in addition to event triggers.
  • -1Manual: FSM instances require explicit calls to their process method (e.g., FSMHandle.Process()) and are not automatically ticked or purely event-driven.
Values less than -1 will be silently coerced to 0 (event-driven).
string processingGroup

The name of the processing group this FSM definition belongs to. FSMs within the same processing group can be managed and processed collectively. Defaults to "Update".
Returns
Type Description
FSMBuilder

An FSMBuilder object, which acts as a fluent API for defining the FSM's states, transitions, and actions.
Remarks

Use this method to either begin designing a brand new FSM from scratch or to retrieve a builder for an FSM that has already been defined. The FSMBuilder returned is your primary tool for adding states, transitions, and configuring event handlers.

If an FSM with the specified fsmName and processingGroup already exists, the builder will be pre-populated with its current definition, allowing for seamless modification.

Exceptions
Type Condition
ArgumentException

Thrown if fsmName or processingGroup is null, empty, or consists only of white-space characters.
| Edit this page View Source

CreateInstance(string, IStateContext, string)

Creates a live instance of a registered FSM definition, binding it to a specific context object. This allows the FSM to manage the state and behaviors of that context dynamically at runtime.

Declaration
public static FSMHandle CreateInstance(string fsmName, IStateContext ctx, string processingGroup = "Update")
Parameters
Type Name Description
string fsmName

The unique name of the FSM definition to instantiate. This must correspond to an FSM previously defined via CreateFiniteStateMachine(string, int, string).
IStateContext ctx

The object that will serve as the FSM's context. This object must implement the IStateContext interface, which provides a common interface for FSM operations regardless of the specific context type.
string processingGroup

The name of the processing group where the FSM definition is registered. This must match the group specified during the FSM's definition. Defaults to "Update".
Returns
Type Description
FSMHandle

An FSMHandle that provides control over the newly created FSM instance, allowing you to trigger events, query its current state, and manage its lifecycle.
Remarks

After defining an FSM structure using CreateFiniteStateMachine(string, int, string), use this method to create active, runnable instances. Each instance operates independently, maintaining its own current state and executing actions based on its bound context object.

The ctx object serves as the 'owner' of the FSM's state. When the FSM transitions, its associated actions and guards typically operate on or retrieve data from this context object.

Exceptions
Type Condition
ArgumentException

Thrown if fsmName or processingGroup is null, empty, or consists only of white-space characters.
ArgumentNullException

Thrown if the provided ctx (context object) is null.
KeyNotFoundException

Thrown if the FSM definition specified by fsmName and processingGroup cannot be found. Ensure the FSM has been defined prior to attempting instantiation.
| Edit this page View Source

CreateProcessingGroup(string)

Ensures an FSM processing group exists within the API's internal management system. FSM instances registered under this group will be processed when the corresponding Tick method (e.g., Update(string)) is called for that specific group.

Declaration
public static void CreateProcessingGroup(string processingGroup)
Parameters
Type Name Description
string processingGroup

The unique name for the processing group to create or ensure exists. Group names are case-sensitive.
Remarks

Calling this method is generally optional, as processing groups are automatically created when an FSM definition or instance is first created within that group. However, you might use this method to pre-initialize a group or to explicitly confirm its existence.

Exceptions
Type Condition
ArgumentException

Thrown if processingGroup is null, empty, or consists only of white-space characters.
